page.title: 15SALPERTON'S OLDEST PERSON
page.content: The oldest inhabitant,the last survivor of a Salperton family, is a spry 80-year-old with thick white hair.She spent her school days at the village school (a building recently demolished ) and was postmistress in days when Salperton had shops and a bus service to Cheltenham.Although outwardly cheerful she admits to feeling depressed .Friends invite her to meals .She takes a housebound pensioner's dog for daily walks. She belongs to the Shipton Oliffe Women's Institute and the Golden Link.Once a week she is driven to a day centre and once a week to the shops in Cheltenham.A busy day gives her something to think about during the long, lonely evenings.
